io.blocko.coinstack.openassets.util

Class Leb128

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.blocko.coinstack.openassets.util.Leb128

  • public final class Leb128
extends Object
    Leb128 format is one of a variable-length quantity format. It is little-endian. Using leb128, small numbers can be compressed and stored in a single byte. Leb128 is used internally to generate an Open Asset ID in Coinstack. There are 2 versions of Leb128: unsigned LEB128 and signed LEB128. 
    
 int numToEncode = 23;
                
 // calculate a encoded length
 System.out.println(Leb128.signedLeb128Size(numToEncode));
        
 // encode an integer to a byte
 byte[] compressedByte = Leb128.writeSignedLeb128(numToEncode);
 System.out.println(compressedByte.length);
        
 // decode a byte to an int
 System.out.println(Leb128.readSignedLeb128(compressedByte));
    Result of the above code will be printed like this 
    
 1
 1
 23
    See DWARF v3 section 7.6 for more details
